WorkItem.Description:
After the last update, the survival soft cap input is no longer adjustable. It seems to now be directly tied to the boss handler, however it changes drastically depending on which bosses I choose and then isnt always the same for each boss if I switch back and forth. 
 
Ex: I have it set to T12 10N Average boss, it sets the soft cap to 435000, but if I switch it to say Shannonx, and then switch it back to Average boss it now becomes 567000. 
 
I don't know if this is related or not but every time I change anything in the boss handler it also changes my characters survival score, didn't used to do that.
WorkItem.Summary: [Bear/BossOpts] Survival Soft Cap not functioning properly

Comments.Message: I also  noticed the same behaviour. I always used to manually change the survival soft cap to a lower value to not pamper my healers too much, but now I can't freely adjust the value. It's been like that for mb the last 2-3 updates or even longer, not sure exactly though.

I'm finding this very frustrating.
Selecting Shannox changes Rawr to wanting me to put Stamina in everything, whereas for every other T12 10N boss it values Stamina very low.
Previously, I'd modify the survival soft cap to give me a more rounded set of RSV's, but the only way now is to remove most of my buffs, which isn't ideal.
It's only started happening in 4.2.4 for me.
